alert.note: Alert for Henry; Oldham; Trimble (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 7:52AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jefferson, Clark, Scott, Washington, northern Oldham, Trimble and Henry Counties through 830 AM EDT... At 751 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Carrollton to 6 miles north of Salem. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
